question.text: Which of the following is incorrect about the experiment performed by T. W. Engelmann?

options.text: Cladophora (a green algae) is used to detect the sites of oxygen evolution.
Suspension of aerobic bacteria is used.
Bacteria accumulated mainly in the region of orange and green part of the light spectrum.
Prism was used to split light into its spectral component.

solution.text: Engelmann, using a prism he split light into spectral components and then illuminated a green algae Cladophora, placed in a suspension of aerobic bacteria. The bacteria were used to detect the site of oxygen evolution. Bacteria accumulated mainly in the region of blue and red light of the split spectrum, this proved that maximum absorption spectrum is observed in blue and red region.
